intro: Aplotaxis discolor, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Aplotaxis discolor is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
